trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> class represents a CMS/PKCS #7 structure for enveloped data.
The Cryptographic Message Syntax RFC specifies the following MIME types and file name extensions for CMS/PKCS #7 messages with these content types.
Content type
MIME type
Extension
envelopedData
application/pkcs7-mime
.p7m
signedData
application/pkcs7-signature
.p7s.p7c
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms> class has the following default property values.
Property
Default value
The default <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType> for recipients is <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.IssuerAndSerialNumber>.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> class by using the specified content information as the inner content type.
For the default property values used with this constructor, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.%23ctor>.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.ContentInfo"></xref> class that represents the content and its type.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> class by using the specified content information and encryption algorithm.
The specified content information is to be used as the inner content type.
For the default property values used with this constructor, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.%23ctor>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo"></xref> object that represents the content and its type.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the encryption algorithm.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType,System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> class by using the specified subject identifier type and content information.
The specified content information is to be used as the inner content type.
For the default property values used with this constructor, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.%23ctor>.
Subjects can be identified by either the issuer and serial number of their public key certificate or by the key identifier of their public key certificate.
A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the means of identifying the recipient.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo"></xref> object that represents the content and its type.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType,System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> class by using the specified subject identifier type, content information, and encryption algorithm.
The specified content information is to be used as the inner content type.
A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the means of identifying the recipient.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo"></xref> object that represents the content and its type.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the encryption algorithm.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Certificates"></xref> property retrieves the set of certificates associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> collection that represents the X.509 certificates used with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
If no certificates exist, the property value is an empty collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.ContentEncryptionAlgorithm"></xref> property retrieves the identifier of the algorithm used to encrypt the content.
If an algorithm identifier was not set in a constructor, this property contains the default value.
For the default property values used with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms> class, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.%23ctor>.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> object that represents the algorithm identifier.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.ContentInfo"></xref> property retrieves the inner content information for the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
If you call any of the decrypt methods, such as <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt>, before viewing this property, the content returned is encrypted.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo"></xref> object that represents the inner content information from the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode(System.Byte[])"></xref> method decodes the specified enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message and resets all member variables in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> object.
This method should be called before <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt?displayProperty=fullName> or any other EnvelopedCms.Decrypt method.
An array of byte values that represent the information to be decoded.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)"></xref> method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the private key associated with the certificate identified by the specified recipient information and by using the specified certificate collection.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)"></xref> method searches the specified certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
.NET Framework Security
The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo"></xref> object that represents the recipient information to use for the decryption.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> collection that represents additional certificates to use for the decryption.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)"></xref> method searches this certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)"></xref> method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the specified certificate collection.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)"></xref> method searches the specified certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
.NET Framework Security
The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> collection that represents additional certificates to use for the decryption.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection)"></xref> method searches this certificate collection and the My certificate store for the proper certificate to use for the decryption.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt"></xref> method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt"></xref> method searches the current user and computer My stores for the appropriate certificate and private key.

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> should be called before <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt?displayProperty=fullName> or any other <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt> method does not search the computer My store if it is inaccessible.
.NET Framework Security
The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo)"></xref> method decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the private key associated with the certificate identified by the specified recipient information.
.NET Framework Security
The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:

A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo"></xref> object that represents the recipient information that identifies the certificate associated with the private key to use for the decryption.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encode"></xref> method encodes the contents of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message and returns it as an array of byte values.
Encryption must be done before encoding.

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt?displayProperty=fullName> or another <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%2A> method must be called before this method.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encode%2A> method does not cause the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to be populated.
If the method succeeds, the method returns an array of byte values that represent the encoded information.
If the method fails, it throws an exception.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt"></xref> method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.
This method displays a user interface in which you choose the recipients for whom to encrypt the message.
This requires that the current process is running in *user interactive mode*, meaning that the <xref:System.Environment.UserInteractive%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `true`.
A process is normally in user interactive mode unless it is a service process or running inside a Web application.
The user interface will only present certificates that are within their validity period and that have key encipherment or key agreement included in their key usage.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt> method does not cause the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to be populated.
.NET Framework Security
The following permissions are required to display the user interface:
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipient)"></xref> method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the specified recipient information.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%28System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipient%29> method does not cause the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to be populated.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipient"></xref> object that represents the recipient information.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipientCollection)"></xref> method encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS #7 message by using the information for the specified list of recipients.
The message is encrypted by using a message encryption key with a symmetric encryption algorithm such as triple DES.
The message encryption key is then encrypted with the public key of each recipient.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%28System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipientCollection%29> method does not cause the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to be populated.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipientCollection"></xref> collection that represents the information for the list of recipients.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos"></xref> property retrieves the recipient information associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.

Although this property is read-only, a modification to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo> objects in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfoCollection> can be done by using their properties.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A> property is not populated as a result of calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method nor any of the overloaded EnvelopedCms.Encrypt methods.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfoCollection"></xref> collection that represents the recipient information.
If no recipients exist, the property value is an empty collection.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.UnprotectedAttributes"></xref> property retrieves the unprotected (unencrypted) attributes associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
Unprotected attributes are not encrypted, and so do not have data confidentiality within an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection"></xref> collection that represents the unprotected attributes.
If no unprotected attributes exist, the property value is an empty collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Version"></xref> property retrieves the version of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
The version determines whether the message is a PKCS #7 message or a Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) message.
CMS is a newer superset of PKCS #7.
An int value that represents the version of the enveloped CMS/PKCS #7 message.
